current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
For the relief of Esidronio Arreola-Saucedo, Maria Elna
		  Cobian Arreola, Nayely Arreola Carlos, and Cindy Jael Arreola.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law or any order,
			 for the purposes of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, Esidronio Arreola-Saucedo, Maria Elna Cobian Arreola, Nayely Arreola
			 Carlos, and Cindy Jael Arreola shall be deemed to have been lawfully admitted
			 to, and remained in, the United States, and shall be eligible for issuance of
			 an immigrant visa or for adjustment of status under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 245 of the
			 Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply only if the
			 applications for issuance of immigrant visas or the applications for adjustment
			 of status are filed with appropriate fees not later than 2 years after the date
			 of the enactment of this Act.

shall instruct the proper
			 officer to reduce by 4, during the current or subsequent fiscal year, the total
			 number of immigrant visas that are made available to natives of the country of
			 birth of Esidronio Arreola-Saucedo, Marina Elna Cobian Arreola, Nayely Arreola
			 Carlos, and Cindy Jael Arreola under

text.#text:
Upon the granting of immigrant visas to
			 Esidronio Arreola-Saucedo, Maria Elna Cobian Arreola, Nayely Arreola Carlos,
			 and Cindy Jael Arreola, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or, if applicable, the total number of
			 immigrant visas that are made available to natives of the country of birth of
			 Esidronio Arreola-Saucedo, Maria Elna Cobian Arreola, Nayely Arreola Carlos,
			 and Cindy Jael Arreola under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 203(a) of the Immigration and
			 Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall be determined by reference to the latest
			 statement titled

, provided that such statement has been submitted prior
			 to the vote on passage.
